alert.note: Alert for Morris (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:40PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dickinson, Geary, southwestern Riley, northwestern Morris and southern Clay Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 939 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Talmage, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Junction City, Abilene, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, Chapman, Solomon, Wakefield, Riley, Enterprise, White City, Milford, Woodbine, Manchester, Longford, Latimer, Talmage, Milford Lake, Moonlight and Keats. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 267 and 305. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central, north central, northeastern and east central Kansas.
